marketNews.title: EMAS: Anak Usaha MDKA, IPO dengan Valuasi Rp29-49 T
marketNews.content:
EMAS is a subsidiary of Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA) and Merdeka Gold Resources (EMAS) planning an IPO offering up to 1.6 billion (10%) new shares at a price range of IDR 1,800-3,020 per share. This implies target proceeds of roughly IDR 2.9-4.9 trillion, with a market capitalisation of about IDR 29-49 trillion.

The proceeds will be used by EMAS for: (1) a capital contribution of IDR 328.4 billion to PT Pani Bersama Tambang; (2) a loan of IDR 328.4 billion to PT Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera; and (3) the remaining amount to repay debt to MDKA.

EMAS, the MDKA subsidiary, plans to develop the Pani gold project in Gorontalo, covering a mining area of 14,670 ha. As of 2024 the Pani project is estimated to contain 292.4 million tonnes of ore with 7 million troy ounces of gold at a grade of 0.75 g/t and reserves of 77.5 million tonnes with 1.9 million troy ounces at 0.78 g/t. The mine life is projected to 2041, with peak gold production in 2033 expected at 500 thousand troy ounces per year.

The company has not yet commenced commercial operations as it is completing a heap-leach processing plant, which is 67 % complete as of 30 June 2025, with mechanical completion projected for November 2025 and commissioning in December 2025.

Future processing capacity plans:
1. 2025-2026: heap-leach plant, 7 Mt/yr, gold output 145 k oz/yr.
2. 2027-2029: carbon-in-leach (CIL) plant, 7.5 Mt/yr, gold output 355 k oz/yr.
3. 2029-2032: upgrade CIL to 12 Mt/yr, gold output 500 k oz/yr.
4. Combined heap-leach and CIL capacity of 19 Mt/yr, gold output up to 500 k oz/yr by 2033.

Shareholding after the IPO: MDKA 56.5 %, treasury 9 %, public 34.5 % (including 10 % from the new issue, 8.36 % held by Winato Kartono, 5.6 % held by Garibaldi Thohir, and other individual shareholders.

Valuation: post-IPO P/BV is expected at 4-5.3× based on 1Q25 (TTM) financials. A P/E multiple cannot be calculated as the company has posted net losses for three consecutive years.

Financial performance: 2024 revenue US$1.7 million, net loss US$12.7 million. In 1Q25, no revenue and a net loss of US$9.2 million. Up to 1Q25, the only operating segment is mining-service; the mining and processing segment is not yet operating. The lack of 1Q25 revenue is due to the acquisition of PT Puncak Emas Tani Sejahtera, increasing ownership from 48.99 % to 99.99 %, fully eliminating mining-service revenue.

marketNews.title: SSIA projects 2025 profit decline and explores corporate actions
marketNews.content: SSIA’s Vice President of Investor Relations & Corporate Communications Erlin Budiman said the company projects 2025 revenue and net profit to fall about –4 % YoY and –14 % YoY respectively, below the original targets of +5 % revenue and +20 % profit. The downgrade is based on the backlog of the Sabang Smartpolitan land sales that will only be recognised in early 2026 and a potential occupancy decline in the hospitality segment due to government budget tightening. CEO Johannes Suriadjaja said the company remains committed to a roughly 30 % dividend payout ratio and is adding about 100 ha of landbank by June 2025. He also said SSIA is reviewing corporate-action options and collaboration opportunities to accelerate Subang Smartpolitan development.

marketNews.title: ASII wholesale sales slump 29 % YoY in August 2025
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that combined wholesale sales of Toyota and Daihatsu vehicles reached 28,174 units in August 2025 (-29 % YoY, -4 % MoM), bringing the combined 8-month total to 245,781 units (-17 % YoY).

marketNews.title: PSAB denies acquisition rumor, remains open to strategic deals
marketNews.content: J Resources Asia Pacific clarified to the IDX that the circulating rumor that United Tractors (UNTR) intends to acquire PSAB’s mining assets is unfounded. PSAB stated it remains open to consider strategic transactions that could add value. In a separate information disclosure, UNTR also said it was unaware of the rumor but is seeking new acquisition opportunities. Bloomberg Technoz reported on 4 September 2025 that UNTR plans to acquire PSAB’s mining assets in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: DATA plans ISP acquisition and IDR 500 bn capex to reach 500 k home-passes
marketNews.content: Remala Abadi’s CEO Abadi Agus Setiono said the company plans to acquire an internet service provider this year to close a home-pass gap. DATA currently has 317,000 home-passes and targets 500,000 by end-2025. The expansion will be funded with up to IDR 500 billion of capex sourced from internal funds, investors and bank loans. The Djarum group will also purchase additional DATA shares, though details were not disclosed.

marketNews.title: IPCM allocates IDR 148 bn for two new tugboats and terminal expansion
marketNews.content: IPCM’s Director of Shipping Services Dessy Emastari Prihatiningtyas said the company will allocate IDR 148 billion through 2026 to add two tugboats, with IDR 80 billion to be spent this year. CEO Shanti Puruhita said the two vessels are expected to be deployed next year. IPCM is also expanding a new dedicated terminal, especially in eastern Indonesia, and targets a 5 % YoY increase in revenue and net profit in 2025.

marketNews.title: Rupiah slides 1.05 % as BI intervenes after finance-minister change
marketNews.content: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 1.05 % to IDR 16,475 per US$ on Tuesday (9 Sept) after President Prabowo Subianto replaced Finance Minister Sri Mulyani with Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa. Bank Indonesia’s Head of Monetary Management and Securities, Erwin Hutapea said the central bank intervened in the foreign-exchange market to keep the rupiah in line with fundamentals.

marketNews.title: Indonesia sovereign-bond auction yields 6.45 % (FR0108) and 5.15 % (SPN12260910)
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance’s Directorate General of Debt and Risk held a sovereign-bond auction on Tuesday (9 Sept). Bids totalled IDR 79.55 trillion; the winning amount was IDR 24.45 trillion, below the indicative target of IDR 27 trillion. The FR0108 bond (maturity 15 Apr 2036) was awarded at a weighted-average yield of 6.45 % for IDR 3.5 trillion, while the SPN12260910 (maturity 10 Sept 2026) was awarded at 5.15 % yield for IDR 5.1 trillion.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister pledges sub-3 % GDP deficit and liquidity support
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said the government will keep the fiscal deficit below 3 % of GDP in line with regulations and will work with Bank Indonesia to ease liquidity and support funding for the economy and government programmes.

marketNews.title: Government to expand stimulus programmes in H2 2025
marketNews.content: Co-ordination Minister Airlangga Hartarto said the government will strengthen economic stimulus in the second half of the year, extending existing programmes such as wage subsidies for workers earning under IDR 10 million, a labor-intensive public-works scheme, a PPh exemption for certain sectors and housing support. No further details on amounts or timing were given.

marketNews.title: Gold spot price hits all-time high of US$3,659.4
marketNews.content: Spot gold rose 0.48 % to US$3,654 per troy ounce on Tuesday (9 Sept) and briefly hit an intraday all-time high of US$3,659.4, extending a 1.4 % gain from Monday. The rise came as markets priced in a possible Fed rate cut next week. US equity indices also rose, with the Nasdaq posting a new all-time high on Monday.

marketNews.title: AISI reports August 2025 domestic motorcycle sales
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Motor Association (AISI) reported domestic two-wheel sales of 578,041 units in August 2025 (+0.7 % YoY, -1.5 % MoM), bringing the 8-month total to about 4.3 million units (-1.7 % YoY), or 64-67 % of the 2025 target of 6.4-6.7 million units (vs 8M24: 69 % actual).

marketNews.title: Brent crude up 0.4 % to US$66.5/bbl on OPEC+ output increase
marketNews.content: Spot Brent crude rose 0.4 % to US$66.5 per barrel on Tuesday (9 Sept) as OPEC+ production is set to rise by 137 k bbl/d in October 2025, following a decision to increase output after a 550 k bbl/d rise in September-August and 411 k bbl/d in July-June 2025.

marketNews.title: Freeport pauses Grasberg underground mining after landslide
marketNews.content: Freeport Indonesia’s VP of Corporate Communications Katri Krisnati said the company will temporarily halt underground mining at the Grasberg mine in Central Papua to safely evacuate seven contractor workers trapped after a landslide on Monday (8 Sept) around 22:00 WIT.

marketNews.title: Rupiah slides 1.05 % after finance-minister change
marketNews.content: The Indonesian rupiah weakened 1.05 % to IDR 16,475 on Tuesday (9 Sept) after President Prabowo Subianto replaced Finance Minister Sri Mulyani with Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa. Bank Indonesia intervened in the foreign-exchange market to keep the rate aligned with fundamentals.

marketNews.title: Other hot topics
marketNews.content: The market’s “hot” list includes: (1) the rupiah’s 1.05 % decline; (2) a sovereign-bond auction that raised IDR 24.45 trillion; (3) Finance Minister Purbaya’s pledge to keep the fiscal deficit under 3 % of GDP; (4) the government’s plan to expand stimulus programmes in H2 2025; (5) spot gold up 0.48 % to US$3,654/oz and an intraday high of US$3,659.4; (6) AISI’s August motor-sales figure of 578,041 units (+0.7 % YoY); (7) Brent crude up 0.4 % to US$66.5/bbl; (8) Freeport’s temporary halt of Grasberg underground mining.
